Datum Basel, den vierden decembris anno etc. 32.

Dem ersamen herr Heinrich Bullinger, prädicant zuͦ Zürich, minem gunstigen lieben herren.
seg.output:
May God increase His grace upon you.
Dear sir, I had wanted to send this enclosed letter to a trusted Zurich resident. Since I have no acquaintance but those whom God has given to me, I cannot send it to anyone but you, whom I now trust, or to Leo.
I ask you to read and consider it, and if it may bear fruit, then let others also read and hear it who are trusted and beloved of God. If not, then keep the letter with you.
Regarding the matter of the five cities, I urge the people to earnest prayer, patience, and strong trust in God; for God is mighty on our side and He often provides us with timely means, so that we may hope in Him alone, lest our Gospel become too carnal and we ultimately be obligated to do so in this time. For Christ, who is in us, will remain Lord and King despite all the world's defiance. If we must suffer and even die for this, it will be to our gain. But God is faithful; He gives us an exit in our trials and does not allow us to be tested beyond what we can bear, etc.
I have been unable to write to you further in these short times. Take from this small amount that which is good in the sight of all believers.
Greetings to Leo, Pellican, and other brothers who love the Lord from the heart. May the grace of God be with you all. Amen.
Dated Basel, the fourth of December, etc. 32.
Your Jacob Meyger, mayor of Basel
To the esteemed sir Heinrich Bullinger, preacher of Zurich, my kindly beloved sir.
